Georgia Secretary of State - Charities Division

incorporation_agency: Georgia Secretary of State - Corporations Division
charitable_registration_agency: Georgia Secretary of State - Charities Division
exemption_threshold_note: Organizations with contributions under $25,000 annually are generally exempt from charitable registration. Religious organizations and certain educational institutions are also exempt.

formation_requirements.filing_agency: Georgia Secretary of State - Corporations Division
formation_requirements.publication_details: Notice of intent to incorporate must be published in official county legal organ once a week for two consecutive weeks
formation_requirements.notes: Georgia requires a registered agent with a physical Georgia address. Publication requirement adds cost and time to incorporation process. Affidavit of publication must be filed after publication.

requirements.filing_agency: Georgia Secretary of State - Corporations Division
requirements.due_date_specifics: Due by April 1st each year for all entities regardless of formation date
required_information: Registered agent name and office address
Names and addresses of officers and directors
requirements.notes: Filing fee is $50 online, $55 by mail. Late fee of $25 applies after April 1st. Failure to file for two consecutive years results in administrative dissolution.

requirements.filing_agency: Georgia Secretary of State - Charities Division
requirements.due_date_specifics: Before soliciting contributions in Georgia (or within 30 days of first solicitation)
required_information: List of officers and directors with addresses
Financial statements for most recent fiscal year
requirements.notes: Registration required before soliciting in Georgia if contributions exceed $25,000 annually. Religious organizations and certain others are exempt.

requirements.filing_agency: Georgia Secretary of State - Charities Division
requirements.due_date_specifics: Due on anniversary of initial registration date
required_information: Updated list of officers and directors
requirements.notes: Annual renewal is required on anniversary date, not fiscal year end. Late filing may result in revocation of registration and inability to solicit.

requirements.requirement_name: Sales and Use Tax Exemption Certificate
requirements.due_date_specifics: Apply after receiving IRS 501(c)(3) determination letter
requirements.notes: Georgia provides sales tax exemption for qualifying 501(c)(3) organizations. Once approved, certificate should be updated periodically. Exemption applies to purchases for charitable purposes. Provide certificate to vendors.

requirements.due_date_specifics: February 1st of the year for which exemption is claimed (January 1st assessment date)
requirements.form_number: Form PT-300-C - Application for Property Tax Exemption (Charitable)
required_information: Description of property use for charitable purposes
requirements.notes: Georgia property tax exemption requires exclusive use for charitable purposes serving the public good. Application must be filed annually. Property cannot be used for private benefit. Contact county tax assessor for specific requirements.

requirements.due_date_specifics: License valid for calendar year; renew annually
required_information: Copy of IRS 501(c)(3) or 501(c)(4) determination letter
Proof of 5+ years continuous operation in Georgia
List of officers and bingo operators
requirements.notes: Georgia law permits charitable bingo for qualifying nonprofits existing 5+ years. Each county/city may have additional ordinances. Prize limits and frequency restrictions apply. Raffles are generally prohibited except for specific exemptions.

Georgia prohibits traditional raffles but allows limited prize promotions where no purchase is required for entry. Prize value limits apply. Organizations must carefully structure promotions to comply with law. Consult legal counsel before conducting.

requirements.filing_agency: Georgia Secretary of State - Charities Division
requirements.due_date_specifics: Renewed annually from initial registration date
requirements.form_number: Form CHAR-300 - Professional Fundraising Counsel Registration
requirements.notes: Fundraising counsel provides consulting but does not solicit or handle contributions. No bond required. Each contract must be filed within 10 days of execution.

requirements.filing_agency: Georgia Secretary of State - Charities Division
requirements.due_date_specifics: Renewed annually from initial registration date
required_information: List of officers and persons involved in solicitation
requirements.notes: Required for paid professional solicitors who solicit on behalf of charities. Each contract must be filed. Bond must remain in effect throughout registration period. Written disclosures required to donors.

requirements.filing_agency: Internal requirement - filed with board and may be included in CHAR-004 filing
requirements.due_date_specifics: Within 180 days after fiscal year end (before renewal filing if required)
requirements.notes: Georgia law does not mandate audits based solely on revenue thresholds, but nonprofit best practices and many funding sources require audits. Organizations receiving federal funds over $750,000 must have Single Audit. Check bylaws and grant agreements for audit requirements.

special_notes.publication_requirement: Georgia uniquely requires publication of intent to incorporate in the county's legal organ for two consecutive weeks before incorporation, adding time and cost to the formation process.
special_notes.anniversary_date_filing: Georgia charitable renewal is based on anniversary of initial registration, not fiscal year end. This is different from most states. Track registration date carefully.
special_notes.raffle_restrictions: Georgia has very restrictive raffle laws. Traditional raffles are generally prohibited. Organizations must structure prize promotions carefully to comply with state law. Legal counsel recommended.
special_notes.five_year_bingo_rule: Organizations must be in continuous operation for 5 years before conducting charitable bingo, longer than most states. This is a significant barrier for newer organizations.
special_notes.board_requirements: Georgia nonprofit corporations must have at least three directors. Directors need not be Georgia residents. Board must meet requirements specified in bylaws.
special_notes.political_activity_limits: 501(c)(3) organizations must comply with federal restrictions on political campaign intervention and lobbying. Georgia law reinforces these federal limits.
special_notes.registration_threshold: Georgia's $25,000 contribution threshold for charitable registration is standard. Organizations under this threshold are exempt but may voluntarily register.
special_notes.professional_fundraiser_contracts: All contracts with professional solicitors or fundraising counsel must be filed with the Secretary of State within 10 days of execution.
special_notes.audit_requirements: Georgia does not mandate audits based on revenue like many states. However, federal Single Audit rules, grantor requirements, and bylaws may require audits. Organizations should assess audit needs based on their circumstances.
special_notes.dissolution_requirements: Upon dissolution, assets must be distributed to organizations with similar charitable purposes or to government. Secretary of State must be notified of dissolution.
special_notes.unrelated_business_income: Organizations with unrelated business income over $1,000 must file IRS Form 990-T and Georgia Corporation Income Tax Return if conducting business in Georgia.
special_notes.online_systems: Georgia has online filing systems for both corporate filings (eCorp) and charitable registrations, making compliance more convenient.
special_notes.property_tax_annual_filing: Unlike some states where property tax exemption is perpetual once granted, Georgia requires annual application by February 1st.
